business.headline: Maximising returns: How to select top mutual funds for your portfolioMutual funds have emerged as a popular investment option, offering a balanced approach to growing wealth without the complexity of managing individual stocks.

'Multiple call recordings exist': Byju's cries foul after auditor BDO resignsIn a strong response to BDO's resignation, Byju's has accused the audit firm of making unethical requests and manipulating the audit process, including suggesting the backdating of financial reports.

Byju's crisis worsens as second auditor BDO resigns over financial concernsBDO's exit comes just a year after Deloitte, the company's previous auditor, stepped down citing problems with Byju's financial reporting.
Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

US adds 1,42,000 jobs in August; unemployment rate drops to 4.2%While the job data fell short of expectations, a slight dip in the unemployment rate to 4.2% indicated that the labour market is gradually cooling off, but not dramatically.

IPO investors are not looking beyond listing gains, are they missing out?According to a Sebi study, 70% of the shares, by value, were sold within a year of the IPO. The quick turnover is particularly noticeable in cases where IPO shares see a strong rise in value right after listing.

Anant Ambani donates 20 kg gold crown worth Rs 15 crore to Lalbaugcha RajaLalbaugcha Raja, Mumbai's most popular Ganesh idol, was unveiled on Thursday ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi. Devotees visit the Lalbaugcha Raja for darshan during the 10-day Ganesh festival.

Explained: Why Godfrey Phillips shares hit record high despite market downturnAt the closing bell, the shares of Godfrey Phillips were up 12.69% at Rs 7,204.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the stock jumped 14.50% to reach a record high of Rs 7,320, defying a sharp correction in the domestic indices.

Tata Motors shares decline for 6th straight day. Is it a good time to buy?Tata Motors stock settled over 1.8% lower on Friday, extending losses for the sixth consecutive session. Read on to know whether it is the right time to buy the stock.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty slips under 24,900 on US data jittersThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1017.23 points to close at 81,183.93, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 292.95 points lower to end at 24,852.15.
Godfrey Phillips set to consider 2:1 bonus issue; shares jump over 9%A bonus issue is a way for companies to reward existing shareholders without making them pay for the additional shares.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 5 lakh croreThe bloodbath on Dalal Street has wiped off nearly Rs 5 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Government may slash petrol, diesel prices as global crude oil rates fallUS crude oil prices dropped by more than 1% on Wednesday, falling below $70 per barrel. Brent crude prices followed suit, falling by $1 to reach $72.75 per barrel.
Bina Modi to vote on behalf of family trust at Godfrey Phillips AGMThe Delhi High Court recently allowed Bina to cast her vote on behalf of the trust, which holds a 47.5% stake in the company.

Goldman Sachs gives SBI 'sell' rating with revised target price. Know whyThe brokerage highlighted a growing risk-reward imbalance for SBI's stock, driven by challenges in maintaining a strong return on assets.

India's household food spending dips to less than 50%: ReportThe change in spending, highlighted in a recent report by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), signals a shift in how Indian families allocate their monthly budgets.
Sensex, Nifty down 1%: What's behind today's stock market turbulence?Today's market turbulence is partly linked to investor jitters ahead of the US non-farm payrolls report expected later today.
Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares tumbled over 14% today As of 11:51 am, Vodafone Idea's shares were trading at Rs13.60, down nearly 10%.
Boss Packaging Solutions makes debut on NSE SME at 25% premiumBoss Packaging Solutions listing: The stock was listed at Rs 82.5 on the NSE SME, marking a 25% premium over its IPO price of Rs 66.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: AAP firm on key Haryana seats in poll alliance talks with Congress: SourcesAAP is holding firm on securing key Assembly seats, particularly Kalayat and at least one seat in Kurukshetra, in its ongoing pre-poll alliance discussions with Congress, according to sources.

Trinamool MP quits post, writes to Mamata Banerjee: 'Never seen such angst'In his letter resigning from the post of Rajya Sabha MP, Trinamool Congress leader Jawhar Sircar cited the "unchecked overbearing attitude of the favoured few and the corrupt" within his own party.
Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh welcome baby girlDeepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh became parents to a baby girl on September 8.

NSA Ajit Doval to visit Russia this week, take up Ukraine peace talks: SourcesNational Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval will visit Russia this week to participate in the BRICS-NSA meeting and to discuss peace efforts amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war.

IC 814 newlyweds: Burger destroyed our honeymoon photos, but we emerged strongerIndian Airlines flight IC 814, which was hijacked in 1999, had 26 couples returning from their honeymoon. Ipseeta and Bipin Menon were two of them. From losing their honeymoon photos to a hijacker to surviving on oranges and milk to avoid going to the clogged toilets, they went through seven hells in eight days. This is the IC 814 story of two newly-weds stuck in a hijack and how they emerged stronger.
Bihar boy, 15, dies after fake doctor performs YouTube-guided surgeryA 15-year-old boy died after a fake doctor operated on him while watching YouTube tutorials, his family alleges.

J&K polls: BJP releases 6th candidates' list, drops ex-Deputy Chief MinisterThe BJP dropped senior leader Kavinder Gupta from the Bahu constituency (formerly Gandhi Nagar) as the party released its sixth list for the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly elections today.

Raghav Chadha cites 'win-win' condition for AAP-Congress alliance in HaryanaSpeaking to the media, AAP Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chaddha said that "ball-by-ball commentary" on the alliance discussion cannot be done and people will be informed once the final decision is made.

India's historic campaign ends with record 29 medals in ParisParis Paralympics 2024: India concluded its historic campaign with a record 29 medals, including seven gold, nine silver, and 13 bronze. India secured the 18th position in the overall medals table, marking the nation's best-ever showing at the Paralympic Games.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

BJP likely to turn to Pashupati Paras to rein in nephew Chirag Paswan: SourcesAccording to sources, Pashupati Paras, who has been marginalised within the BJP-led NDA for some time, could soon be made the Governor of a state or the chairman of an important central board.

Passenger train halted in Bihar due to decoupling of bogies, none hurtAccording to the railway officials, the coupling of the Magadh Express from New Delhi to Islampur broke, splitting the train into two in Bihar's Buxar district. No passengers were hurt in the incident.

Nita Ambani in pics with Anant Ambani, Radhika Merchant at Ganesh Chaturthi eventNita Ambani posed with her son Anant and daughter-in-law Radhika Merchant at the family's Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations held at their Mumbai residence.

Actor Vijay's party recognised by poll panel, aims for 2026 Tamil Nadu electionTamil actor Vijay's political party, Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), has been officially recognised by the Election Commission. The actor said, 'the first door has opened'.

Exclusive: Taslima Nasreen's India stay at risk? Says 'I'll surely die if...'Taslima Nasreen, who was exiled from Bangladesh and has been living in India for many years, is facing uncertainty about her future in the country, as she claims the Indian government has yet to renew her residence permit.

Ground report: In a first, rights-deprived Valmikis to vote in J&K pollsFor the first time, around 10,000 members of the Valmiki community will exercise their right to vote in the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly elections.
Singing not that bad: Tauba Tauba singer Karan Aujla to fan throwing shoe at himIndian-Canadian singer Karan Aujla had to stop his London show recently after an audience member threw a shoe at him.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Vinesh Phogat begins poll campaign as Congress candidate from Haryana's JulanaCongress fielded wrestler Vinesh Phogat from Julana Assembly constituency for the Haryana Assembly election. She kicked off her campaign today from Bakta Khera, her husband's ancestral village.

How Gen Z and millennials made Sarojini Nagar a bigger flex than Zara, H&MSarojini is a brand in itself, trusted by everyone from fashion influencers and celebrity fashion stylists, to young enthusiasts who do not mind braving the mad crowds even on a hot summer noon to scout the best of fashion picks.

Why Iran's Sadegh was disqualified from Paralympics javelin finalIran's Beit Sadegh won gold in Men's Javelin Throw F41 at the Paris Paralympics, only to be shockingly disqualified for a code violation, turning India's Navdeep Singh's silver into an unexpected gold.

Joe Biden was on vacation for 40% of his presidency, claim RepublicansAccording to RNC Research, a Republican platform, Joe Biden has spent about 40 per cent of his presidency, or 532 days, on vacation, while the average American receives 10 to 14 days of vacation per year.

Viral video shows BJP workers pushing constable into SUV, Akhilesh Yadav reactsSharing a video of the incident, former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP workers of "kidnapping the police" and questioned whether cops had to go to BJP headquarters to file the FIR.

Tamil Nadu couple poisons 9-day-old girl, buries body in backyard; arrestedTamil Nadu's Vellore police have arrested a couple accused of poisoning their nine-day-old baby girl due to their reluctance to raise a second daughter. The couple buried the child in their backyard, and after a complaint was filed, they were arrested and placed in judicial custody.

When Ranveer Singh said he wanted a daughter like Deepika PadukoneBollywood star Ranveer Singh had once expressed a desire to have a daughter like wife and star Deepika Padukone. The couple recently welcomed a baby girl, sources confirmed to IndiaToday.in.

Nicole Kidman skips Venice award ceremony after mother's deathHollywood star Nicole Kidman was unable to accept her Venice acting award in person after learning of her mother's death. Kidman later shared a statement regarding the same.

Randhir Singh becomes first Indian to be elected as OCA presidentRandhir Singh has become the first Indian to be elected president of the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA). His unanimous election took place during the 44th General Assembly of the OCA.

Imran Majid: Indian drag racer aims to be world's fastest with 'love' ImzillaIn an exclusive interaction with IndiaToday.in, Indian drag racer Imran Majid talks about how he came into the sport, the future of it in India and his dream of making the fastest car in the world with his true 'love', Imzilla.

Jurel equals Dhoni's record of most catches in an innings in Duleep TrophyIndia A wicketkeeper Dhruv Jurel equalled MS Dhoni's record for the most catches by a wicketkeeper in an innings during the Duleep Trophy match against India B. Jurel's seven catches were instrumental in restricting India B to 184 runs.

While Fritz is taking part in his maiden Grand Slam final, Sinner made the record for becoming the first Italian man to qualify for the final at Flushing Meadows.

Moeen Ali retires from international cricket after Australia series snubEngland all-rounder Moeen Ali announced his retirement from international cricket at the age of 37. He would continue playing franchise cricket and might consider taking a coaching role later on.

Sabalenka reveals 'Tiger-head' bet with fitness coach on US Open triumphAryna Sabalenka's fitness coach Jason Stacy sported a tiger tattoo on his head which was part of a hilarious bet between the two, just before Sabalenka clinched her first US Open title by defeating Jessica Pegula in a thrilling final.

Rebecca Cheptegei's death exposes a tragic pattern in Kenyan athletics communityMarathoner Rebecca Cheptegei, who competed in the Paris Olympics last month, was tragically set on fire by her boyfriend this week, according to police. This incident marks the fourth horrific killing of an Olympian in Kenya in the past three years. The rising statistics on domestic violence in Kenya underscore a troubling trend, with these tragedies bringing renewed global attention to the issue.

Avesh Khan's response after Chinnaswamy erupts with RCB chants in Duleep TrophyAvesh Khan gave a priceless response after the Chinnaswamy crowd started teasing him with the chants of 'RCB-RCB'. Avesh was representing India A in Duleep Trophy.

Sabalenka wants to 'put family's name in tennis history' after US Open triumphAryna Sabalenka won her maiden US Open title as she beat Jessica Pegula 7-5, 7-5 in final at Flushing Meadows. She dedicated her triumph to her family who didn't give up on her.

Paralympics, Day 11: India's schedule and closing ceremony full detailsIndia's record-breaking performance at the Paris Paralympics 2024, with 29 medals, will be celebrated as the Games conclude. The final day and closing ceremony promise a fitting tribute to the athletes' incredible achievements and resilience.

Paralympics: Record-breaking show of Indian track and field stars in ParisParalympics 2024: Indian athletics contingent put up a sensational show in the Paris Paralympics, by clinching 17 medals. The historic run was a massive step up for Indian track and field athletes who had won eight medals in the previous edition in Tokyo.

OTD in 2022: Virat Kohli's 1020-day wait for 71st ton ended with T20I hundredVirat Kohli notched up his maiden T20I hundred on this day in 2022. This also ended his 1020-day prolonged wait for his 71st century. Kohli scored 122 runs from 61 balls against Afghanistan.

Watch: Aryna Sabalenka pops champagne as she celebrates maiden US Open triumphAryna Sabalenka popped the champagne and sprayed it all on her team in the dressing room as they celebrated Belarusian's US Open 2024 triumph. The World No. 2 beat USA's Jessica Pegula in a thrilling final.

Watch: Navdeep Singh's huge 47.32m throw that won him Paralympics gold Paris Paralympics 2024: India's Navdeep Singh bagged the gold medal with a throw of 47.32 metres in the men's javelin event on Saturday, September 7.

Simran, Navdeep Singh take India's medal tally to 29 Paralympics 2024: Simran Sharma bagged the bronze medal in the women's 200m T12 event while Navdeep Singh clinched gold in the men's javelin throw F41.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
